name: FBAB Seest
subtitle: Competition-winning sustainable social housing - FSC timber with DGNB Gold

executive_summary.headline: National competition winner demonstrating FSC timber construction achievable within social housing budget
key_achievements: Won 2013 national competition for sustainable social housing
executive_summary.why_tier2: Bio-based timber construction rather than material reuse. DGNB Gold validates sustainability but CO2 reduction not quantified. Strong policy significance as national competition winner.

competition_organizer.name: Danish Ministry for Cities, Housing and Rural Districts

materials.description: FSC-certified wood construction throughout - only support pillars in concrete
Heat-treated spruce cladding - thermal modification eliminates need for preservatives
Wood fiber insulation for thermal performance
On-site rainwater retention - zero runoff to sewer

co2_reduction.note: Timber construction vs conventional - significant reduction claimed but not measured

key_insights: FSC timber achievable within social housing budget
Heat-treated wood eliminates ongoing chemical treatment
DGNB Gold compatible with affordable rents
Competition format drives innovation in social housing

narrative.driver: National competition by Danish Ministry to demonstrate sustainable social housing concepts at affordable rents.
narrative.approach: FSC timber construction throughout with heat-treated spruce facades. Wood fiber insulation. Zero rainwater runoff design. Achieved DGNB Gold while maintaining market-appropriate rents.
narrative.significance: Competition winner proving timber construction viable for Danish social housing sector.
narrative.legacy: Included in Building Damage Fund's 2020 quality guide as reference project.
